reviews.review_msg: David is really passionate about what he is doing. Theories of counseling is a really interesting class and you learn a lot. It was a pleasure going to his classes. 2 papers + 1 (200mc) final that is not schedule in the final exam period, but in the last class. TAKE IT~

Paul is such a tough marker! I found his lectures to be dry and it was hard to retain the information. His weekly quizzes were horrendous, I'm an avid note-taker/textbook reader and I found myself getting 4/10 - 7/10 on each quiz no matter how much I studied. Even the way you have to name the file of your assignments was an unnecessary hassle!

Paul is a really nice person. But this course had a syllabus that was more than 30 pages, and even with all that the assignments were still unclear. It's hard to know what you're being graded on, and assignments are constantly being added or changed. It felt chaotic and disorganized. Avoid if you can.

Very good prof. His exams are the right amount of challenging. He listens to your questions and responds only if he has the answer. If not, he does get back to you. Prompt with e-mails, dynamic, pushes the boundaries of the classroom. Take any course with him!

His lectures were a bit information heavy as there was a lot to get through, but classes were often broken up with group activities. Tests were fair, and based mainly on his lectures but also included textbook information that he didn't mention in class! He's very approachable, one of the nicest professors I've ever had.

I took EDUC 323 for counseling, and since he was a counselor, we always got interesting stories about cases that he'd done before. He was an excellent teacher and was always readily available to students. He gives good advice for those who want to go into counseling.
Heads up: there's a lot of group discussion in this course!
I really enjoyed the way this class was set up, and Kel is an amazing and caring teacher. Enjoyed his counselling stories. Overall very easy, but participation really matters.

Kel was one of the best prof's I've had in four years at SFU. He is really knowledgable about the course material and shows the application of theory to practice by using personal examples to tie the course to real life making the content more engaging. He is extremely approachable and easy to talk to, as well as understanding and caring . 10/10

Doesn't seem very knowledgeable about certain things. He is an easy marker though, and will answer questions. If you're looking for an easy A, I would take him, but if you're looking to really learn and engage in detailed discussion, you won't find it from him.
You won't regret taking her courses. Very caring prof who wants you to succeed in her class.

Karen was a great professor, especially for the online format. Really encouraged to go at your own pace, as each module spans two weeks. She responded quickly to emails and bi-weekly announcements were helpful reminders for deadlines (as well as personal touches and well wishes). Super kind and knowledgable.

Karen is an amazing professor who genuinely cares about her students. She has clear expectations and is always available when you need clarification or have any questions. I will always take classes with her!
Rod was an inspirational teacher who  provided me  with great insight in becoming a school counselor.
You are the MAN. Thank you for a great class. Too bad some students were not behaving as adults.

This teacher is pathetic. Its like he knows nothing about the subject, won't say certain words coz "he can't pronounce it", mumbles, abandons what he was saying in mid sentence to jump on to something else, no notes no coverage by chapter, just slaps a format of how he expects exams to be written. Am a 3rd year student, this was a horrendous class.
He was very helpful and I enjoyed doing our class presentation.
He was really helpful to me and gave a great insight into the real world of school counseling.
I really enjoyed his personal insights into the topics on counseling.
This instructor was clear with instructions and provided time and energy to his  lesson plans and classes. look forward to taking another class with this instructor.

Find another instructor if you MUST take this class. The course itself is not bad, however, the presentation minimally met expectations and was fraught with inconsistencies and failed promises. Several of the students in my class were teachers. I am confident that asking/paying a few of them to teach the class would have been much more helpful.

If you need this class, I suggest you look for a different instructor. I found him generally unclear and not very helpful. If I asked questions, I remained equally confused. The textbook (Corey) is not bad, however, although locating specific terms and their definitions can be trick.

Even though sometimes grading criteria was unclear, if you come to class, pay attention and participate you will do well. You do not not get much feedback throughout but she is more than happy to meet with you to discuss the assignments. Approachable and caring professor that makes you find joy in learning rather than being hardcore about grades

The whole class is not very organized.  The Canvas shell is hard to navigate and updated randomly.  Textbook is very hard to read.  Class lectures are ok.  Her quizzes are very hard and all based on theory.  Overall I didnt enjoy this class.

Although very kind, Sharalyn was not the ideal professor, especially for online learning. Not accessible at ALL outside of class, very slow on grading, Canvas page/syllabus very unorganized creating a high anxiety class experience. This class was a huge disappointment and I wish I had a different professor, or that Sharalyn had a TA to help.

Nice in class, but she doesn't grade fast. Most people have 5/9 grades posted. She doesn't reply to emails or phone calls, not even when she prompts us to. She only gives full marks on papers if she "forgets that she's reading a student paper." She doesn't get you feedback for your group papers because she can't set up group on Canvas properly.

Sharalyn is very kind but does not answer her emails, does not provide clear grading criteria, does not release grades on canvas, and her quizzes and lectures are confusing and scattered. Very disorganized and clearly she needs a TA and a separate email to cope with the work. Dont recommend online as when you cant email her its so hard to complete

Sharalyn is super nice and approachable but that can only get you so far in a learning environment. We didn't get feedback on any assignments, had almost no grading criteria and she ignored our e-mails. I hope in the future she can get a TA to help with this stuff because if she organized better the class would've been so much more enjoyable!

Sharalyn is an awful communicator. I had her for a required upper-division course and nobody in my class was ever able to contact her after class time. She is terribly disorganized and not well versed in technology. Her Canvas page was terribly disorganized. She was not quick at marking and giving feedback. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE

Amazing professor. Very kind, approachable, understanding and accommodating to students. Lectures are always interesting. Assignments and exams not hard if you keep up with readings and attend lecture. Weekly quizzes, very easy if you just do the reading. Overall, amazing and would highly recommend her!!! Take this class with her :)
